meanings.definition: Experienced or skilled in a particular area
meanings.sent1: She is quite versed in painting landscapes.
meanings.sent2: He is a versed chef, known for his delicious dishes.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed oddly versed in opening doors.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were versed in detecting even the slightest movement.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor was versed in navigating stormy seas.

meanings.sent1: Being versed in the local customs, she easily adapted to the new culture.
meanings.sent2: He is well versed in the history of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was surprisingly versed in imitating human speech.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library, versed in the tales of old.
meanings.sent5: The detective was versed in solving mysterious cases.

meanings.definition: Competent or proficient in a particular skill or subject
meanings.sent1: The young pianist was already quite versed in playing classical music.
meanings.sent2: She became versed in coding after attending the programming course.
meanings.sent3: The robot was oddly versed in poetry recitation.
meanings.sent4: His hands were versed in the art of sculpting beauty from stone.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was versed in breaking records with each competition.
